servers.description: The root API resource and starting point for the Realm API.

get.summary: Enumerate available Realm administration authentication providers.

post.summary:
Authenticate as a Realm administrator. Use [GET
/auth/providers](undefinedget-/auth/providers) to list the available
authentication providers.

access_token.description:
An access token you may provide in the `Authorization` header of API
requests. `realm-api-authentication` demonstrates how to use this token.

refresh_token.description:
A refresh token you may provide in the `Authorization` header of [POST
auth/session](undefinedpost-auth/session) to obtain a new `access_token`
for the current user session.

user_id.description: The unique \_id value of the MongoDB Cloud user.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The authentication provider to use.

get.summary: Get information about the currently logged in user.

401.description: invalid refresh token: incorrect token type

trigger](https://docs.atlas.mongodb.com/triggers) apps.

parameters.name: defaults
parameters.description: Whether or not to create a default application.

an application as a zip file.

200.description: The build information was successfully retrieved.

Retrieve a [service's](/realm/services#std-label-services)

requestBody.description: The new state of the rule.

post.summary: Sample a subset of documents in a collection to generate a JSON schema.

database_name.description: The name of the database that contains the collection.

collection_name.description: The name of the collection to sample and generate a schema for.

limit.description: The maximum number of documents to include in the sample.

Retrieve a [webhook](/realm/services#std-label-service-webhooks).

requestBody.description: The updated state of the webhook.

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: The Service ID for the linked cluster.

get.summary:
List [push
notifications](/realm/push-notifications#std-label-push-notifications).

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Only list notifications with the given state.

get.summary:
Retrieve a [push
notification](/realm/push-notifications#std-label-push-notifications)
message.
List [users](/realm/authentication#std-label-user-accounts).

post.summary:
Verify a that a user's [client access
token](/realm/reference/authenticate-http-client-requests#std-label-get-client-api-access-token)
is valid.

requestBody.description: The user's client access token \. This is distinct from the `API access token `\_ you need to authenticate to the admin API.

200.description:
Success returns this object. A 200 [may also return token
expired](/realm/reference/authenticate-http-client-requests#std-label-verify-client-access-token-responses).

aud.description:
Optional; specifies which Resource Servers the JWT is valid for. Omitted
if empty.

exp.description: Unix timestamp after which the JWT expires.

iat.description: Unix timestamp at which the JWT was issued.

custom_user_data.description:
Optional; contains [custom user
data](/realm/users/enable-custom-user-data#std-label-custom-user-data)
if it exists for the user. Only present if the access token is created
after custom user data is enabled and configured. Omitted if empty.

domain_id.description: The UID representing the app domain.

data.description: Optional: any metadata stored with the token. Omitted if empty.

get.summary: Retrieve a [user](/realm/authentication#std-label-user-accounts).
List a user's devices.

400.description:
User is already confirmed or Email/Password authentication is not
enabled.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description:
The user as which to execute the function. Either `user_id` or
`run_as_system` is required. You cannot specify both.

parameters.name: run_as_system
parameters.description:
Determine whether or not to run as system user. Either `run_as_system`
or `user_id` is required. You cannot specify both.

service.description: The service to use when calling this function.

name.description: The name of the function you want to run.

arguments.description: Any arguments that your function needs.

post.summary:
Execute a [function](/realm/functions#std-label-functions)'s source code
for testing.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description:
The user as which to execute the function. Either `user_id` or
`run_as_system` is required. You cannot specify both.

parameters.name: run_as_system
parameters.description:
Determine whether or not to run as system user. Either `run_as_system`
or `user_id` is required. You cannot specify both.

eval_source.description:
This JSON expression must evaluate to `true` before the function may
run. If this field is blank, it will evaluate to `true`.

get.summary:
List [authentication
providers](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/authentication/providers)
within a Realm app.

Retrieve information about one of an application's [authentication
providers](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/authentication/providers)

List the allowed [HTTP
origins](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Origin)
from which MongoDB Realm should allow requests.

post.summary:
Set the allowed [HTTP
origins](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Origin)
from which MongoDB Realm should allow requests.

items.description: An HTTP origin. Must be of the form `<scheme>://<host>[:port]`.

204.description: The allowed HTTP origins were successfully set.

get.summary: List the allowed entries in the Access List of your Realm app.

post.summary:
Create an IP address or CIDR block in the Access List for your Realm
app.

patch.summary: Modify an IP address or CIDR block in the Access List of your Realm app

parameters.name: ipId
parameters.description:
The IP address entry denoted by `ip_id` with the information given in
the request body

delete.summary:
Delete an IP address or CIDR block from the Access List of your Realm
app

404.description: No IP addresses or CIDR blocks to delete

get.summary: Retrieve MongoDB Realm logs.

parameters.name: co_id
parameters.description: Return only log messages associated with the given request ID.

parameters.name: errors_only
parameters.description: Whether to only return errors.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Return only log messages associated with the given `user_id`.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description:
The date and time in ISO 8601 at which to begin returning results,
exclusive.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description:
The date and time in ISO 8601 at which to cease returning results,
inclusive.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description:
The offset number of matching log entries to skip before including them
in the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The maximum number of log entries to include in the response. If the
query matches more than this many logs, it returns documents in
ascending order by date until the limit is reached.

app_id.description:
The ObjectID of your application.
`realm-api-project-and-application-ids` demonstrates how to find this
value.

nextEndDate.description:
The end date and time of the next page of log entries in ISO 8601
format. MongoDB Realm paginates the result sets of queries that match
more than 100 log entries and includes this field in paginated
responses. To get the next page of up to 100 entries, pass this value as
the `end_date` parameter in a subsequent request.

nextSkip.description:
The offset into the next page of log entries in ISO 8601 format. MongoDB
Realm paginates the result sets of queries that match more than 100 log
entries and includes this field in paginated responses where the first
entry on the next page has the same timestamp as the last entry on this
page. To get the next page of up to 100 entries, pass this value, if it
is present, as the `skip` parameter in a subsequent request.

get.summary:
List [API keys](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/authentication/api-key)
associated with a Realm app.

200.description: The API keys were successfully listed.

201.description: The API key was successfully created.

get.summary:
Retrieve information about an [API
key](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/authentication/api-key).

200.description: The API key was successfully retrieved.

204.description: The API key was successfully deleted.
The API key was successfully enabled.
The API key was successfully disabled.

get.summary:
List
[secrets](/realm/values-and-secrets/define-and-manage-secrets#std-label-define-secret)
associated with a Realm app.

put.summary:
Modify a
[Secret](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/values-and-secrets/define-and-manage-secrets)
associated with a Realm app.

requestBody.description: The modified value of the Secret.

Delete a
[Secret](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/values-and-secrets/define-and-manage-secrets)

Retrieve a [function](/realm/functions#std-label-functions).

List [external
dependencies](/realm/functions#std-label-external-dependencies) uploaded
to the Realm app.
Return the 100 most recent application deployments.
Return the current application deployment draft, if applicable.

post.summary: Create a new application deployment draft, if none exists.

delete.summary: Discard the specified application deployment draft.

post.summary: Deploy the specified application deployment draft.

get.summary:
Return a diff between the currently deployed application and the
specified draft.
List all hosted assets.

post.summary: Move or copy a hosted asset to a new resource path.

requestBody.description:
The hosted asset file and its metadata. (Must use
`Content-Type: multipart/mixed`)

move_from.description:
The current resource path of the asset to move. Must be used with
`move_to`.

move_to.description:
The resource path to which the asset will move. Must be used with
`move_from`.

copy_from.description:
The current resource path of the asset to copy. Must be used with
`copy_to`.

copy_to.description:
The resource path to which the asset will be copied. Must be used with
`copy_from`.

get.summary: Retrieve metadata for a specific hosted asset

200.description: Successfully retrieved metadata for the hosted file.

put.summary: Upload or replace an asset at a specific resource path.

requestBody.description:
The hosted asset file and its metadata. (Must use
`Content-Type: multipart/mixed`)

file.description: The asset file to upload (encoded as binary).

patch.summary:
Update the metadata attributes of a hosted asset at a specific resource
path.

requestBody.description:
The new metadata attributes for the hosted asset. These attributes
replace all existing attributes for the file.

get.summary:
List the request, compute, sync, and data transfer usage in a given
period for [billing](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/billing) purposes.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
The ISO 8601 date and time of the start of the query period. Default is
00:00:00 UTC on the first day of the current month.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description:
The ISO 8601 date and time of the end of the query period. Default is
23:59:59 UTC on the the last day of the current month.

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description:
Specifies the granularity of the query period, either P31D (31 day) or
PT1H (1 hour). Default is P31D.

start.description:
The [RFC 3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/3339) date and time of the
start of the query period, which can be specified with the `start` query
parameter.

end.description:
The [RFC 3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/3339) date and time of the
end of the query period, which can be specified with the `end` query
parameter.

granularity.description:
The granularity, which can be specified with the `granularity` query
parameter.

name.description:
The usage metric represented by each data point. See
[billing](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/billing).

units.description: The unit of the `value` of each data point.

data_points.description:
The array of data points for this measurement. A finer `granularity`
results in more data points.

timestamp.description: The ISO 8601 date and time of the data point.

value.description: The value at the time in the `unit` of the measurement.

get.summary:
List the request, compute, sync, data transfer, and memory usage of a
specific app in a given period for
[billing](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/billing) purposes.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
The ISO 8601 date and time of the start of the query period. Default is
00:00:00 UTC on the first day of the current month.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description:
The ISO 8601 date and time of the end of the query period. Default is
23:59:59 UTC on the the last day of the current month.

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description:
Specifies the granularity of the query period, either P31D (31 day) or
PT1H (1 hour). Default is P31D.

start.description:
The RFC 3339 date and time of the start of the query period, which can
be specified with the `start` query parameter.

end.description:
The RFC 3339 date and time of the end of the query period, which can be
specified with the `end` query parameter.

granularity.description:
The granularity, which can be specified with the `granularity` query
parameter.

appId.description: The Realm app ID specified by the `appId` path parameter.

appName.description: The name of the Realm app specified by the `appId` path parameter.

name.description:
The usage metric represented by each data point. See
[billing](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/billing).

units.description: The unit of the `value` of each data point.

data_points.description:
The array of data points for this measurement. A finer `granularity`
results in more data points.

timestamp.description: The ISO 8601 date and time of the data point.

value.description: The value at the time in the `unit` of the measurement.

AssetResourcePath.name: path
AssetResourcePath.description: The resource path of a hosted asset.

AssetResourcePathPrefix.name: prefix
AssetResourcePathPrefix.description:
Return only those assets where the resource path begins with the
specified prefix.

AppId.name: appId
AppId.description:
The ObjectID of your application.
`realm-api-project-and-application-ids` demonstrates how to find this
value.

UsersAfter.name: after
UsersAfter.description: The `id` of the last user returned by a previous paginated request.

UsersSort.name: sort
UsersSort.description:
The field name to sort to sort results by. The only valid value is the
default: `_id`.

UsersDesc.name: desc
UsersDesc.description:
If `true`, returns sorted results in descending order. If not specified
or set to \`\`false, results return in ascending order.

last_used.description: The time this app was last used.

last_modified.description: The time this app was last modified.

product.description: The product this app is for.

environment.description: The environment the app is in.

version.description:
Human-readable version information about the mongod instance. This
string will take the format `<major>.<minor>.<patch>`.

gitVersion.description:
The commit identifier that identifies the state of the code use to build
the mongod.

versionArray.description:
An array that conveys version information about the mongod instance. See
version for a more readable version of this string.

javascriptEngine.description:
A string that reports the JavaScript engine used in the mongod instance.
By default, this is `mozjs` after version `3.2`, and previously `V8`.

bits.description:
A number that reflects the target processor architecture of the mongod
binary.

debug.description:
A boolean that reflects whether or not the `mongod` instance was built
with debugging options.

maxBsonObjectSize.description:
A number that reports the [Maximum BSON Document
Size](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/limits/#BSON-Document-Size)

_id.description: The dependency collection's unique internal ID.

user_id.description:
The unique `_id` value of the MongoDB Cloud user that uploaded the
dependency collection.

last_modified.description:
The time at which the dependencies were uploaded in [Unix
time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time) (number of seconds since
January 1, 1970 at 00:00 UTC).

dependencies_list.description:
An array of documents that each describe a dependency uploaded to the
application.

name.description: The name of the uploaded dependency.

version.description: The version of the uploaded dependency.

_id.description: The unique ID of the draft.

user_id.description: The unique \_id value of the MongoDB Cloud user that created the draft.

_id.description: The unique ID of the deployment.

app_id.description: The unique \_id value of the Realm app.

draft_id.description:
The unique \_id value of the deployment draft associated with the
deployment, if applicable.

user_id.description: The unique \_id value of the MongoDB Cloud user that deployed the draft.

deployed_at.description:
The time at which the deployment was made. Represented as the number of
seconds since January 1, 1970.

origin.description: The deployment method used to create the deployment.

commit.description: The commit hash of the deployment (Automatic GitHub Deployment)

status.description: A message that indicates whether or not the deployment was successful.

status_error_message.description:
The error message of the error that caused the deployment to fail, if
applicable.

diff_url.description:
A link to the diff of changes in the deployment (Automatic GitHub
Deployment)

diffs.description:
A list where each item is the line-by-line diff for a specific
configuration file.

hosting_files_diff.description:
The filenames of hosted files that have been added, removed, or
modified.

items.description:
A list where each element is the name of a file that was added in the
draft.

A list where each element is the name of a file that was deleted in the
draft.

A list where each element is the name of a file that was changed in the
draft.

error.description: A message that describes the error.

name.description: Can only contain ASCII letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens.

template_id.description:
Name of [supported template
app](/realm/manage-apps/create/template-apps#std-label-template-apps) to
serve as base template.

clusterName.description: Name of Atlas cluster associated with the Realm app.

can_evaluate.description:
A JSON expression that evaluates to `true` if the Function is allowed to
run in response to an incoming request.

name.description: A unique name for the Function.

private.description:
If `true`, the function is hidden from client applications. You can
still call a private function from JSON expressions and other functions,
including incoming webhooks and triggers.

source.description:
The stringified source code for the function. The code must be valid
ES6.

run_as_system.description:
If `true`, the function executes with full privileges, bypassing rules
on all services.

can_evaluate.description:
A JSON expression that evaluates to `true` if the Function is allowed to
run in response to an incoming request.

name.description: A unique name for the Function.

private.description:
If `true`, the function is hidden from client applications. You can
still call a private function from JSON expressions and other functions,
including incoming webhooks and triggers.

source.description:
The stringified source code for the function. The code must be valid
ES6.

service_id.description: The Service ID for the currently synced cluster, if there is one.

partition_fields.description:
A list of valid partition keys based on the cluster's collection
schemas.

_id.description: The unique ID of the trigger.

function_id.description: The ID of the function associated with the trigger.

function_name.description: The name of the function associated with the trigger.

disabled.description: If true, the trigger is disabled and will not fire.

function_id.description: The ID of the function associated with the trigger.

disabled.description: Default: `false` If true, the trigger is disabled.

config.description: An object that defines configuration values for the trigger.

operation_types.description:
**Required for Database Triggers** -- The [database event operation
types](/realm/triggers/database-triggers#std-label-database-events) to
listen for. This must contain at least one value.

operation_type.description:
**Required for Authentication Triggers** -- The [authentication
operation
type](/realm/triggers/authentication-triggers#std-label-authentication-event-operation-types)
to listen for.

providers.description:
**Only Available for Authentication Triggers** -- A list of one or more
[authentication
provider](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/authentication/providers) id
values. The trigger will only listen for authentication events produced
by these providers.

database.description:
**Required for Database Triggers** -- The name of the MongoDB database
that contains the watched collection.

collection.description:
**Required for Database Triggers** -- The name of the MongoDB collection
that the trigger watches for change events. The collection must be part
of the specified database.

service_id.description:
**Required for Database Triggers** -- The ID of the MongoDB Service
associated with the trigger.

match.description:
**Only Available for Database Triggers** -- A
[$match](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/operator/aggregation/match)
expression document that MongoDB Realm includes in the underlying change
stream pipeline for the trigger. This is useful when you want to filter
change events beyond their operation type. The trigger will only fire if
the expression evaluates to true for a given change event.

full_document.description:
**Only Available for Database Triggers** -- If true, indicates that
`UPDATE` change events should include the most current
[majority-committed](https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/read-concern-majority/)
version of the modified document in the `fullDocument` field.

full_document_before_change.description:
**Only Available for Database Triggers** -- If true, indicates that the
`UPDATE` change event response should include a copy of the modified
document from before the update was applied.
[Preimages](/realm/mongodb/trigger-preimages#std-label-trigger-preimages)
must be enabled.

schedule.description:
**Only Available for Scheduled Triggers** -- A [cron
expression](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/triggers/cron-expressions)
that defines the trigger schedule.

event_processors.description:
An object where each field name is an event processor ID and each value
is an object that configures its corresponding event processor. The
following event processors are supported: `AWS_EVENTBRIDGE` For an
example configuration object, see [Send Trigger Events to AWS
EventBridge](/realm/triggers/examples/send-events-aws-eventbridge#std-label-event_processor_example).

path.description: The resource path of the asset

size.description: The size of the asset in bytes

attrs.description:
An array of documents that each describe a [metadata
attribute](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/hosting/file-metadata-attributes)
that applies to the asset.

hash.description: The MD5 checksum hash for the asset

appId.description: The unique App ID of the Realm app that is hosting the file.

last_modified.description:
The time at which the hosted asset was last modified in [Unix
time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time) (number of seconds since
January 1, 1970 at 00:00 UTC).

url.description: The full URL of the hosted asset.

path.description: The resource path of the hosted asset

size.description: The size of the hosted asset in bytes

attrs.description:
An array of documents that each describe a [metadata
attribute](https://docs.mongodb.com/realm/hosting/file-metadata-attributes)
that applies to the asset.

hash.description: The MD5 checksum hash for the hosted asset

tokenAuth.description:
The authorization token provided in the `access_token` field of the
[POST
/auth/providers/{provider}/login](undefinedpost-/auth/providers/%7Bprovider%7D/login)
and [POST /auth/session](undefinedpost-/auth/session) API endpoints.

refreshAuth.description:
The authorization token provided in the `refresh_token` field of the
[POST
/auth/providers/{provider}/login](undefinedpost-/auth/providers/%7Bprovider%7D/login)
API endpoint.

ClientErrorResponse.description: There is an error in the request.
